column3: MISSINGNESS: Is this required to be present if this form is submitted?
column4: CONFORMITY: What values/ranges/characters, etc. are allowed for this field?
column5: PLAUSIBILITY: Is this concept or a concept related to it assessed again at any point within any other UDSv4 IVP forms (including witihin the same form)?
column20: PLAUSIBILITY: Was this concept assessed in any previous versions of the UDS?
column23: PLAUSIBILITY: Is this concept assessing something that can plausibly change from one visit to another (e.g., diabetes at visit 1 and no diabetes at visit 2; severe impairment at visit 1 and no impairment at visit 2, etc.)?
column24: How many errors/alerts should there be for this variable?
column25: Short version of question for english test output (for data core)

column1: G1. Check this box and enter “88” below for the Total GDS Score if and only if the subject:  1.) does not attempt the GDS, or 2.) answers fewer than 12 questions.
1. Are you basically satisfied with your life?
2. Have you dropped many of your activities and interests?
3. Do you feel that your life is empty?
5. Are you in good spirits most of the time?
6. Are you afraid that something bad is going to happen to you?
column25: Q6. AFRAID (Afraid something bad will happen?)

column1: 7. Do you feel happy most of the time?
column25: Q7. HAPPY (Happy most of the time?)

column1: 9. Do you prefer to stay at home, rather than going out and doing new things?
10. Do you feel you have more problems with memory than most?
column25: Q10. MEMPROB (More problems with memory than most?)

column1: 11. Do you think it is wonderful to be alive now?
12. Do you feel pretty worthless the way you are now?
13. Do you feel full of energy?
14. Do you feel that your situation is hopeless?
15. Do you think that most people are better off than you are?
column25: Q15. Better (Most others are better off?)

column1: 16. Sum all checked answers for a Total GDS Score
